snippet: Shell is confident it will get final approval from regulators to begin drilling for oil off the Alaskan coast this year, despite embarrassing delays and equipment problems.
abstract: Shell says it remains confident that it will soon get final approval from regulators and be able to begin drilling for oil in Arctic waters off the Alaskan coast, despite embarrassing delays and trouble with equipment.
lead_paragraph: Shell is confident it will get final approval from regulators to begin drilling for oil off the Alaskan coast this year, despite embarrassing delays and equipment problems.

headline.seo: Arctic Drilling by Shell Expected to Begin This Year
headline.main: Arctic Drilling Will Begin This Year, Shell Official Says
headline.print_headline: Arctic Drilling Will Begin This Year, Shell Official Says
